meanings.definition: The extent of a property that faces a street or water.
meanings.sent1: The frontages of the houses on our street are all beautifully landscaped.
meanings.sent2: The store's frontages were decorated with colorful banners to attract customers.
meanings.sent3: The ducks enjoyed swimming along the frontages of the lake, showing off their graceful movements.
meanings.sent4: The frontages of the city buildings stood tall and proud, reflecting the morning sunlight.
meanings.sent5: As we walked down the street, the frontages of the shops seemed to invite us in with their welcoming displays.

meanings.definition: The act of facing or being situated at the front.
meanings.sent1: The frontages of the soldiers were stern as they stood in formation.
meanings.sent2: The frontages of the houses in the neighborhood all had colorful doors.
meanings.sent3: The frontages of the students in the class showed their eagerness to learn.
meanings.sent4: The frontages of the cars in the parking lot gleamed under the bright sun.
meanings.sent5: The frontages of the mountains were covered in a blanket of snow, creating a picturesque scene.

meanings.definition: The front part of a building or piece of land.
meanings.sent1: The frontages of the mansion were adorned with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent2: The frontages of the park were filled with blooming flowers in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The frontages of the cake were decorated with colorful frosting designs.
meanings.sent4: The frontages of the garden were a riot of colors with various flowers in bloom.
meanings.sent5: The frontages of the theater were grand and imposing, hinting at the performances within.
